subject: Photography
title: Cropping for Impact
description: A quick, practical guide to Cropping for Impact.

hook.text: The frame you capture isn't always the frame you keep. Cropping in post can save ‚Äî or transform ‚Äî a photo.

buildup.text: Cropping removes distracting edges, tightens composition, and changes aspect ratio after the shot.

discovery.text: Henri Cartier-Bresson never cropped. He composed in-camera. Others treat cropping as a vital creative tool.

twist.text: Cropping throws away pixels. Crop too aggressively and you lose resolution and print quality.

climax.text: The best approach: compose as tightly as possible in-camera, then crop only for fine-tuning.

punchline.text: Get it right in the viewfinder. Fix the rest with a crop.

quiz.question: What is a downside of heavy cropping?
options: It reduces resolution and image quality
